definition: to offer (tribute)/to present respectfully (to superior, ancestor, deity etc)/to esteem/to revere/to believe in (a religion)/to wait upon/to accept orders (from superior)
to say/to tell/to announce/to report/to denounce/to file a lawsuit/to sue

sentences.english: I have the pleasure to inform you that I have entered into partnership with Mr. K. Kono.
sentences.chinese: 本人已與河野謙吉先生合夥營業，特此奉告。

sentences.english: We acquaint you that we have established ourselves as general agents under the title of Chambers Co.
sentences.chinese: 我們將以錢伯斯公司爲名，開設總代銷店，特此奉告。

sentences.english: I believe i said no comment.
Putin’s chief spokesman yesterday said he had ‘no comment’ on the reports.
sentences.chinese: 普京的主要發言人昨天表示對上述報道“無可奉告”。

sentences.english: In thanking you for your esteemed order of the 5th May, I inform you that it has this day been executed.
sentences.chinese: 感謝您5月5日的定單，本月已經履約，特此奉告。

sentences.english: The specifications and external appearance of this unit are subject to change without notice.
sentences.chinese: 本機的規格和外形有所變更時，恕不另行奉告。

sentences.english: We are pleased to inform you that goods have been dispatched today.
sentences.chinese: 貨物今日業已啓運，特此奉告。

sentences.english: Since you're not being told by the brain to stop eating, you overeat.
sentences.chinese: 如果你不被大腦奉告停止喫，你就會過食。

sentences.english: The Bible recognizes the uselessness and even danger of yes-men.
sentences.chinese: 聖經奉告我們這些人的沒用和危險性。

sentences.english: I have nothing to say about the incident.
Then Ilsa tells Rick that why she had to leave him without any explanation.
sentences.chinese: 然後伊爾莎奉告力克爲什麼會不辭而別。

sentences.english: We might say that our products are the very best on the market.
sentences.chinese: 順便奉告，我方產品在市場上獨佔鰲頭。

sentences.english: C. I'd like to tell you something that will make you surprised.
sentences.chinese: 我想奉告一件使你感到驚訝的事。
梁洛施發言人表示無可奉告。

sentences.english: We acquaint you that we have established ourselves as general agent under the title of Chamber & Co.
sentences.chinese: 我們將以錢伯斯公司爲名，開設總代銷店，特此奉告。

definition: to say clearly/to argue clearly/to pronounce/pronounced
a secret/sth best not told to anyone/confidential information
this is no small thing (idiom)/to have a serious matter at hand
to make sth difficult/to create obstacles
to thank sb personally/to thank sb to his face
lit. to guard one's mouth like a closed bottle (idiom); tight-lipped/reticent/not breathing a word
